snippet.textDisplay:
I've finished it yesterday on an old rig: i5-3470, 16 gigs of ram, RTX 2060. Runs fine on low-medium settings with occasional stutter here and there, but I blame it on Oculus Link being in Beta.
BTW, Kiwi/Mamut grips or even a simple hair tie let you attach the Oculus Touch controllers to your hands and use the thumbstick with open palm.
snippet.textOriginal:
I've finished it yesterday on an old rig: i5-3470, 16 gigs of ram, RTX 2060. Runs fine on low-medium settings with occasional stutter here and there, but I blame it on Oculus Link being in Beta.
BTW, Kiwi/Mamut grips or even a simple hair tie let you attach the Oculus Touch controllers to your hands and use the thumbstick with open palm.

snippet.textDisplay:
Good review of various cards and headsets! I'm running it on i7-6700, gtx 1660ti, 16gb ram and ssd, get some low memory messages. It defaults to low settings. I bumped up a few of the individual settings manually and it's ok but too many it gets a little jittery.
I'm adding 16gb more ram this week anyway, but I dont know if it'll matter to this game or not because the low mem msgs could be graphics, but I'll know by tomorrow!
PS: I'll trade 36 rolls of toilet paper for 1080 or 2080ti!? LoL
snippet.textOriginal:
Good review of various cards and headsets! I'm running it on i7-6700,  gtx 1660ti, 16gb ram and ssd, get some low memory messages.  It defaults to low settings.  I bumped up a few of the individual settings manually and it's ok but too many it gets a little jittery.
I'm adding 16gb more ram this week anyway, but I dont know if it'll matter to this game or not because the low mem msgs could be graphics, but I'll know by tomorrow!
PS: I'll trade 36 rolls of toilet paper for 1080 or 2080ti!? LoL

snippet.textDisplay:
There is something that I don'T get about the VR, I'm pretty interested into the Idea of upgrading FPS with a headset screen to allow head rotation but why are all VR game meant to be play with motionsensitive wii-mote like controlers... I juste want to play standard FPS with keyboard and mouse but a headset freelook independant from my legs(keyboard) movement does that existe?
Imo it would be a good transitive step to make the technology avalaible to a broader audience, juste to focus on converting screen into an headset, making game for that and then/along making fullVR controllers game.
Marketing wise it would be better no?

snippet.textDisplay:
I want to upgrade my gaming PC with an RTX 2070 Super and I currently have a GTX 1080. Other than the card itself and an 800w PSU like a Supernova or something (My PSU is currently only 400w), would I need to upgrade anything else in order to not bottleneck my entire experience? Mainly I use my PC for gaming and it's even specifically more just for VR via my Oculus playing games like Elite Dangerous, No Man's Sky, some Star Citizen (until it gets better) and other games like that. I'll list my other PC specs below; thank you to anyone and everyone who might be able to assist.

Alienware - Aurora R7 Gaming Desktop - Intel Core i7-8700 - 16GB Memory - NVIDIA GTX 1080 - 2TB HDD + Intel Optane Memory
snippet.textOriginal:
I want to upgrade my gaming PC with an RTX 2070 Super and I currently have a GTX 1080.  Other than the card itself and an 800w PSU like a Supernova or something (My PSU is currently only 400w), would I need to upgrade anything else in order to not bottleneck my entire experience?  Mainly I use my PC for gaming and it's even specifically more just for VR via my Oculus playing games like Elite Dangerous, No Man's Sky, some Star Citizen (until it gets better) and other games like that.  I'll list my other PC specs below; thank you to anyone and everyone who might be able to assist.

Alienware - Aurora R7 Gaming Desktop - Intel Core i7-8700 - 16GB Memory - NVIDIA GTX 1080 - 2TB HDD + Intel Optane Memory

snippet.authorDisplayName: R E T R O R A M P A G E
snippet.textDisplay:
So I'm building my first PC, I'm planning on doing VR eventually. Not just half life alyx but a ton of games. Will the Ryzen 5 3600 be okay? Or should I go up to the Ryzen 7 3700x? The reason I ask is I'm already a bit overbudget and I can't afford a Ryzen 7 just yet, but if the performance bump is big enough I'll wait to build and get it.


The GPU I'll be using is a gigabyte aorus Radeon RX 5700 XT.
More than likely I'm just gonna be going for a Oculus Rift S, as I doubt I'll ever be able to afford a Valve Index.
snippet.textOriginal:
So I'm building my first PC, I'm planning on doing VR eventually.  Not just half life alyx but a ton of games. Will the Ryzen 5 3600 be okay?  Or should I go up to the Ryzen 7 3700x? The reason I ask is I'm already a bit overbudget and I can't afford a Ryzen 7 just yet, but if the performance bump is big enough I'll wait to build and get it.


 The GPU I'll be using is a gigabyte aorus Radeon RX 5700 XT.
More than likely I'm just gonna be going for a Oculus Rift S, as I doubt I'll ever be able to afford a Valve Index.

snippet.textDisplay: At first I was excited about this video and how it would probably give good consumer advice. But I feel a couple of things were left out. How does Alyx play on a Vive Pro? (there was only this cryptic reference saying we should not watch his Vive Pro review? Not everyone watches all your videos and knows what you mean.) How much value does a wireless VR headset give for the Alyx experience and which headsets have that option? What about Alyx on the Vive Cosmos?
snippet.textOriginal: At first I was excited about this video and how it would probably give good consumer advice. But I feel a couple of things were left out. How does Alyx play on a Vive Pro? (there was only this cryptic reference saying we should not watch his Vive Pro review? Not everyone watches all your videos and knows what you mean.) How much value does a wireless VR headset give for the Alyx experience and which headsets have that option? What about Alyx on the Vive Cosmos?

snippet.textDisplay: I am really interested in Alyx and was wondering about hardware a lot recently. As someone who plays mainly strategy games (and minecraft), I dont really worry about graphics that much, I focus on cpu and ram more. My pc is a reasonable build from 2016 (i5 6600k on 4,3ghz and r9 fury nitro), but its getting old, when it comes to games. I have plans to upgrade (or maybe just build an entirely new pc) somewhere around the end of 2020 to the mid 2021. And I also wanted to get into vr. Seeing that gpu isnt really that much for hl alyx is good news, I wont have to spend too much on it, considering I wouldnt use it elsewhere anyway. Now for vr kit - index controllers is a must have. All fingers tracking seems so much better then other solutions. For the headseat - I dont really know. Index is impressive, but without expensive gpu I wouldnt need it anyway, right? Vive or oculus should be just fine in this case
snippet.textOriginal: I am really interested in Alyx and was wondering about hardware a lot recently. As someone who plays mainly strategy games (and minecraft), I dont really worry about graphics that much, I focus on cpu and ram more. My pc is a reasonable build from 2016 (i5 6600k on 4,3ghz and r9 fury nitro), but its getting old, when it comes to games. I have plans to upgrade (or maybe just build an entirely new pc) somewhere around the end of 2020 to the mid 2021. And I also wanted to get into vr. Seeing that gpu isnt really that much for hl alyx is good news, I wont have to spend too much on it, considering I wouldnt use it elsewhere anyway. Now for vr kit - index controllers is a must have. All fingers tracking seems so much better then other solutions. For the headseat - I dont really know. Index is impressive, but without expensive gpu I wouldnt need it anyway, right? Vive or oculus should be just fine in this case

snippet.textDisplay: My answer is: 0 $. I have VR, but i use it  for sim racing / racing games, if it's supported. Otherwise, VR, as it is now, must die. It's not easy to setup and it has lots of troubleshooting. Fuck VR, fuck valve and whoever decided that this game needs to be vr only.
snippet.textOriginal: My answer is: 0 $. I have VR, but i use it  for sim racing / racing games, if it's supported. Otherwise, VR, as it is now, must die. It's not easy to setup and it has lots of troubleshooting. Fuck VR, fuck valve and whoever decided that this game needs to be vr only.

snippet.textDisplay: you missed a key point of difference,  wile spending more on the index for better controllers you loose out on the abillity to use the oculus store, buy going downt the rift s route youd have access to both oculus store and steam,  yes i get that this is only in relation to hl alyx but lets face it you have to  play somthing else at some point an if im honest for me at least it would be better to have access to more content and games than a better controller, add to the fact that if you look hard enough there are accessories out there for the oculus controllers to alow you to release without droping them so then your only leaft with having to use your bottom 3 fingers off one button but a nice compromise when you consider pricing, im not sure how gfx pricing works over there but in UK an rtx2070 super is around £500 and a rx5700xt is around £340 the rift s is  £399 vs the quest bundle at £919 an while alyx is then free that is still a hefty jump for most people, personly id recomend the oculus and rx5700xt putting you overly at £739 plus £40-£46 for alyx, especially since it dont use ray tracing, an i aint saying this cos i got an rx5700xt an am some sort of fanboy cos im still running with a gtx1070 but without being sponcered buy any particular brand ect you cant deny the vale for money option especially when you factor in all the vr headset costs

snippet.textDisplay: Small tip: do “not” use screen mirroring with VR games that already mirror its output (spectator mode) together with screen recording (letting the screen mirror 3-7 times (yea this causes huge lag or even disconnects for obvious reasons on low end systems)
snippet.textOriginal: Small tip: do “not” use screen mirroring with VR games that already mirror its output (spectator mode) together with screen recording (letting the screen mirror 3-7 times (yea this causes huge lag or even disconnects for obvious reasons on low end systems)

snippet.textDisplay: I have the CableCreation Active USB Extension Cable as well. I found that the Oculus link to my Quest using the extender and the Anker 3ft USB 3.0 A-C cable was inferior to the Anker 10ft USB 3.0 A-C cable. The 10ft plays Alyx on low settings mostly smooth with my 8 year old i5 3570k (OC 4.2GHz) and a 970 GTX. Just bought it today and enjoyed 50-72 fps most of the time. It got even better when I overclocked the GPU by 400MHz for the RAM and 50MHz for the GPU. Best quarantine surprise thus far!
snippet.textOriginal: I have the CableCreation Active USB Extension Cable as well. I found that the Oculus link to my Quest using the extender and the Anker 3ft USB 3.0 A-C cable was inferior to the Anker 10ft USB 3.0 A-C cable. The 10ft plays Alyx on low settings mostly smooth with my 8 year old i5 3570k (OC 4.2GHz) and a 970 GTX. Just bought it today and enjoyed 50-72 fps most of the time. It got even better when I overclocked the GPU by 400MHz for the RAM and 50MHz for the GPU. Best quarantine surprise thus far!
